name: Pesto Penne Primavera
author: Mikey's Kitchen
summary: This is a recipe you can serve hot or cold. A great side-dish or can be a full meal. My kids love this and it's always a hit. You could also add poached or grilled chicken. You can also freeze any leftover pesto for later use.
ingredients: ½ cup diced roasted red pepper
directions: Combine the basil, garlic, 1/4 cup pine nuts, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, 1/4 cup olive oil, and lemon juice in a food processor and blend until well combined and has the texture of fresh pesto; set aside
Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook the pasta in boiling water until cooked yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes; drain
Transfer the pasta to a large bowl
Pour 1 tablespoon olive oil over the pasta and toss to coat; set aside
Heat 1 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Roast the pine nuts in the skillet until lightly browned; remove to a plate and set aside
Add the asparagus, zucchini, Kalamata olives, roasted red pepper, and sun-dried tomatoes to the skillet; cook and stir until hot, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir the pine nuts into the vegetable mixture
Add the pasta and about 1/4 cup of the pesto, or more to your liking, to the skillet and toss to combine
Serve in bowls topped with the grated Parmesan cheese
